TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000MUjpS:ref

Hi Botond,

Apologies for the delay in replying to you on this.

Many thanks for the update. We can investigate the possibility of updating the server but as this would require a new Windows Server licence it is not something we are going to be able to do quickly. Also from a Microsoft perspective this is still a supported version of Windows that is still receiving updates with an end of life date of  12th January 2027.

Does this mean is it Netwrix / CoSoSys that has ended support for Windows Server 2016? If so can the product documentation be updated to reflect this as on the "Client Installer" page 2016 is shown as being supported.

[cid:image001.png@01DBA259.EEBE9CA0]

Kind Regards,
Andrew

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437507 - - [EXTERNAL] Client not reporting correctly after upgrade [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MUjpS:ref ]

Hi Andrew,

Thank you for your patience!
I received the following feedback from the R&D team:
Since the customer uses and old version of Windows, they customer need to upgrade it in order to use builds from patch 5.9.4.1 and up. This version of Windows is missing some patches, which cause incompatibilities with the latest client version.

Best regards,

TextBody:
Hi Andrew,

Thank you for your feedback!
I forwarded it to the R&D team and I will let you know what their reply is.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer

--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Andrew Temple [andrew.temple@oysterbaysystems.com]
Sent: 3/31/2025 6:28 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437507 - - [EXTERNAL] Client not reporting correctly after upgrade [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MUjpS:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000MUjpS:ref



Hi Botond,

 

Apologies for the delay in replying to you on this.

 

Many thanks for the update. We can investigate the possibility of updating the server but as this would require a new Windows Server licence it is not something we are going to be able to do quickly. Also from a Microsoft perspective this is still a supported version of Windows that is still receiving updates with an end of life date of  12th January 2027. 

 

Does this mean is it Netwrix / CoSoSys that has ended support for Windows Server 2016? If so can the product documentation be updated to reflect this as on the “Client Installer” page 2016 is shown as being supported.

 



 

Kind Regards,

Andrew

 



From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: 21 March 2025 13:27
To: andrew.temple@oysterbaysystems.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437507 - - [EXTERNAL] Client not reporting correctly after upgrade [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MUjpS:ref ]



 

Hi Andrew,

Thank you for your patience!
I received the following feedback from the R&D team:
Since the customer uses and old version of Windows, they customer need to upgrade it in order to use builds from patch 5.9.4.1 and up. This version of Windows is missing some patches, which cause incompatibilities with the latest client version.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

TextBody:
Hi Andrew,

I received the following feedback from the product team:

As part of Netwrix's strategy and commitment to providing solutions with the highest security standards, we have updated the cryptography components in EPP Clients with the 5.9.4.1 release. As a result, support for Windows XP, 7, 8, early builds of Windows 10, and Windows Server 2016 has been discontinued. Initially, this was not planned, but due to the lack of standard support and fixes from Microsoft for these operating systems and cryptography engines, we cannot offer new EPP Clients for them. To maintain EPP coverage on these systems, customers should continue using EPP Client version 5.9.4.0. Please note that no new features or fixes will be backported to this release. This known limitation will be detailed in the upcoming Release Notes.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437507 - - [EXTERNAL] Client not reporting correctly after upgrade [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MUjpS:ref ]

Hi Andrew,

Thank you for your feedback!
I forwarded it to the R&D team and I will let you know what their reply is.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000MUjpS:ref



Hi Botond,

 

Apologies for the delay in replying to you on this.

 

Many thanks for the update. We can investigate the possibility of updating the server but as this would require a new Windows Server licence it is not something we are going to be able to do quickly. Also from a Microsoft perspective this is still a supported version of Windows that is still receiving updates with an end of life date of  12th January 2027. 

 

Does this mean is it Netwrix / CoSoSys that has ended support for Windows Server 2016? If so can the product documentation be updated to reflect this as on the “Client Installer” page 2016 is shown as being supported.

 



 

Kind Regards,

Andrew

 



From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: 21 March 2025 13:27

Hi Andrew,

Thank you for your patience!
I received the following feedback from the R&D team:
Since the customer uses and old version of Windows, they customer need to upgrade it in order to use builds from patch 5.9.4.1 and up. This version of Windows is missing some patches, which cause incompatibilities with the latest client version.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000MUjpS:ref

Hi Botond,

Many thanks for the update on this. I will use this information as part of my business case for upgrading the server operating system. In the meantime we will continue using the version of the agent which is currently installed.

I really appreciate all your time and efforts on this, please feel free to go ahead and close the ticket.

Kind Regards,
Andrew


From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: 02 April 2025 12:06
To: andrew.temple@oysterbaysystems.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #437507 - - [EXTERNAL] Client not reporting correctly after upgrade [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0MUjpS:ref ]

Hi Andrew,

I received the following feedback from the product team:

As part of Netwrix's strategy and commitment to providing solutions with the highest security standards, we have updated the cryptography components in EPP Clients with the 5.9.4.1 release. As a result, support for Windows XP, 7, 8, early builds of Windows 10, and Windows Server 2016 has been discontinued. Initially, this was not planned, but due to the lack of standard support and fixes from Microsoft for these operating systems and cryptography engines, we cannot offer new EPP Clients for them. To maintain EPP coverage on these systems, customers should continue using EPP Client version 5.9.4.0. Please note that no new features or fixes will be backported to this release. This known limitation will be detailed in the upcoming Release Notes.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com<http://www.endpointprotector.com>

Apologies for the delay in replying to you on this.

Many thanks for the update. We can investigate the possibility of updating the server but as this would require a new Windows Server licence it is not something we are going to be able to do quickly. Also from a Microsoft perspective this is still a supported version of Windows that is still receiving updates with an end of life date of  12th January 2027.

Does this mean is it Netwrix / CoSoSys that has ended support for Windows Server 2016? If so can the product documentation be updated to reflect this as on the "Client Installer" page 2016 is shown as being supported.

Hi Andrew,

I received the following feedback from the product team:

As part of Netwrix's strategy and commitment to providing solutions with the highest security standards, we have updated the cryptography components in EPP Clients with the 5.9.4.1 release. As a result, support for Windows XP, 7, 8, early builds of Windows 10, and Windows Server 2016 has been discontinued. Initially, this was not planned, but due to the lack of standard support and fixes from Microsoft for these operating systems and cryptography engines, we cannot offer new EPP Clients for them. To maintain EPP coverage on these systems, customers should continue using EPP Client version 5.9.4.0. Please note that no new features or fixes will be backported to this release. This known limitation will be detailed in the upcoming Release Notes.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
